o 1 jar grape leaves o 1 cup rice o 1 small onion o 1/4 cup pine nuts o 1/4 cup currants o 1/4 cup lemon juice o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions : o Rinse grape leaves and pat dry. o Sauté diced onion in olive oil until translucent. o Add rice, pine nuts, and currants, cook for 5 minutes. o Add 1 cup water, lemon juice, and salt, simmer until rice is tender. o Place a spoonful of rice mixture on each grape leaf and roll tightly. o Arrange dolmas in a pot, cover with water, and simmer for 30 minutes. o Serve warm or chilled. Dumplings

o 1 package dumpling wrappers o 1/2 pound ground pork o 1/2 cup chopped cabbage o 1/4 cup chopped green onions o 2 cloves garlic o 1 tablespoon soy sauce o 1 teaspoon sesame oil o Oil for frying  Instructions : o Mix ground pork, cabbage, green onions, minced garlic, soy sauce, and sesame oil in a bowl. o Place a spoonful of filling on each wrapper and fold to seal. o Fry in hot oil until golden, then steam for 5 minutes. o Serve with dipping sauce. Edamame
o 1 pound edamame (soybeans in pods) o 1 tablespoon sea salt  Instructions : o Steam or boil edamame until tender (about 5 minutes). o Drain and sprinkle with sea salt. o Serve warm. Egusi Soup

o 1 cup ground egusi seeds o 1/2 pound beef o 1/2 pound fish o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 4 tomatoes o 1/4 cup palm oil o 1 teaspoon crayfish powder o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper o 4 cups water o 1/4 cup spinach  Instructions : o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic in palm oil until softened. o Add diced tomatoes, ground egusi seeds, and crayfish powder, cook for 5 minutes. o Add beef, fish, salt, pepper, and water, simmer until meat is tender. o Stir in chopped spinach and cook for 5 minutes. o Serve warm.

o 1 package egg roll wrappers o 1 cup shredded cabbage o 1/2 cup grated carrots o 1/2 cup bean sprouts o 1/4 cup chopped green onions o 2 tablespoons soy sauce o 1 tablespoon sesame oil o Oil for frying  Instructions : o Mix cabbage, carrots, bean sprouts, green onions, soy sauce, and sesame oil in a bowl. o Place a spoonful of filling on each wrapper and roll tightly. o Fry in hot oil until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve with dipping sauce. Elote

o 4 ears of corn o 1/4 cup mayonnaise o 1/4 cup sour cream o 1/2 cup cotija cheese o 1 teaspoon chili powder o 1 lime  Instructions : o Grill the corn until charred. o Mix mayonnaise and sour cream in a bowl. o Brush the mixture onto the corn. o Sprinkle with cotija cheese and chili powder. o Squeeze lime juice over the top and serve. Empanadas

o 2 cups flour o 1/2 cup butter o 1/4 cup water o 1 egg o 1/2 pound ground beef o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup olives o 1/4 cup raisins o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 teaspoon paprika o 1 teaspoon salt o Oil for frying  Instructions : o Mix flour, butter, water, and beaten egg to form a dough, then let rest. o Sauté ground beef, diced onion, minced garlic, chopped olives, and raisins with cumin, paprika, and salt until cooked. o Roll out dough and cut into circles. o Place a spoonful of filling on each circle and fold to seal. o Fry in hot oil until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve warm. Escalivada

o 2 eggplants o 2 bell peppers o 2 tomatoes o 1 small onion o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions : o Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). o Roast eggplants, bell peppers, tomatoes, and onion until tender. o Peel and slice vegetables. o Arrange on a plate and drizzle with olive oil. o Sprinkle with salt and serve warm or at room temperature. Falafel

o 1 can chickpeas o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup parsley o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 teaspoon coriander o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/4 cup flour o Oil for frying  Instructions : o Drain and rinse chickpeas. o Blend chickpeas, diced onion, minced garlic, chopped parsley, cumin, coriander, and salt in a food processor. o Add flour and mix until combined. o Form mixture into balls and fry in hot oil until golden.

o 2 cups cassava flour o 1/4 cup butter o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup bacon o 1/4 cup parsley o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions : o Sauté diced bacon, onion, and minced garlic in butter until crispy. o Add cassava flour and cook, stirring constantly, until golden. o Stir in chopped parsley and salt. o Serve warm. Fattoush

o 2 pita breads o 4 tomatoes o 1 cucumber o 1 small red onion o 1/4 cup parsley o 1/4 cup mint o 1/4 cup lemon juice o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1 teaspoon sumac o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions : o Toast pita breads until crispy, then break into pieces. o Dice tomatoes and cucumber, slice red onion. o Mix vegetables with chopped parsley and mint. o Whisk lemon juice, olive oil, sumac, and salt, then pour over salad. o Toss well and serve. Fava
o 1 cup yellow split peas o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1/4 cup lemon juice o 1 teaspoon salt

o 2 cups cooked beans o 1/4 cup bacon o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup cassava flour o 1/4 cup parsley o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions : o Sauté diced bacon, onion, and minced garlic until crispy. o Add cooked beans and cassava flour, stir to combine. o Stir in chopped parsley and salt. o Serve warm. Festival

o 2 cups flour o 1/4 cup cornmeal o 1/4 cup sugar o 1 tablespoon baking powder o 1/2 teaspoon salt o 1/4 cup milk o Oil for frying  Instructions : o Mix flour, cornmeal, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a bowl. o Add milk and stir until dough forms. o Roll out dough and cut into strips. o Fry in hot oil until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve warm. Focaccia

o 2 1/4 teaspoons active dry yeast o 1 teaspoon sugar o 1 cup warm water o 2 1/2 cups flour o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/4 cup olive oil o Rosemary o Sea salt  Instructions : o Dissolve yeast and sugar in warm water, let sit until foamy. o Mix flour and salt in a bowl, then add yeast mixture and olive oil. o Knead until smooth, then let rise until doubled. o Press dough into a baking pan, dimple with fingers, and sprinkle with rosemary and sea salt. o Bake at 400°F (200°C) for 20-25 minutes until golden. Freekeh Salad

o 1 cup freekeh o 2 cups water o 1 small onion o 1/4 cup parsley o 1/4 cup mint o 1/4 cup lemon juice o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions : o Rinse freekeh and cook in water until tender, then drain. o Sauté diced onion in olive oil until softened. o Mix freekeh with sautéed onion, chopped parsley, and mint. o Whisk lemon juice, olive oil, and salt, then pour over salad. o Toss well and serve. Fried Plantains

o 2 ripe plantains o 1 cup vegetable oil o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions : o Peel and slice plantains. o Heat oil in a pan and fry plantain slices until golden. o Drain on paper towels and sprinkle with salt. o Serve warm. Fried Rice

o 2 cups cooked rice o 1 small onion o 1/2 cup peas o 1/2 cup diced carrots o 2 eggs o 2 tablespoons soy sauce o 1 tablespoon sesame oil o 1/4 cup chopped green onions  Instructions : o Sauté diced onion, peas, and carrots in sesame oil until softened. o Push vegetables to the side and scramble eggs in the same pan. o Add cooked rice and soy sauce, stir to combine. o Cook until heated through. o Garnish with chopped green onions and serve. Fufu

subsection_analysis.section_title: o  2 cups cassava flour o  4 cups water   Instructions :
subsection_analysis.refined_text: o Bring water to a boil. o Gradually add cassava flour, stirring constantly until thickened. o Continue to cook, stirring, until smooth and elastic. o Serve warm. Gamja Jorim

o 4 potatoes o 1/4 cup soy sauce o 2 tablespoons sugar o 1 tablespoon sesame oil o 1/4 cup water o 1 tablespoon sesame seeds  Instructions : o Peel and dice potatoes. o Sauté potatoes in sesame oil until lightly browned. o Add soy sauce, sugar, and water, simmer until potatoes are tender. o Garnish with sesame seeds and serve warm. Garlic Bread

o 1 baguette o 1/2 cup butter o 4 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup parsley o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions : o Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). o Slice baguette in half lengthwise. o Mix softened butter with minced garlic, chopped parsley, and salt. o Spread mixture on bread. o Bake for 10-15 minutes until golden. o Serve warm. Gazpacho

o 4 tomatoes o 1 cucumber o 1 small red onion o 1 bell pepper o 2 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup olive oil o 2 tablespoons red wine vinegar o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper  Instructions : o Dice tomatoes, cucumber, onion, and bell pepper. o Blend vegetables with minced garlic, olive oil, vinegar, salt, and pepper until

o 2 cups giant beans o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 4 tomatoes o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1 teaspoon oregano o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper  Instructions : o Soak beans overnight, then cook until tender. o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic in olive oil until softened. o Add diced tomatoes, oregano, salt, and pepper, simmer for 10 minutes. o Mix beans with tomato sauce and transfer to a baking dish. o Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 30 minutes. o Serve warm. Goi Cuon (Spring Rolls)

o 1 package rice paper wrappers o 1/2 pound shrimp o 1/2 cup rice vermicelli o 1/2 cup lettuce o 1/4 cup mint o 1/4 cup cilantro o 1/4 cup basil o 1/4 cup carrots o 1/4 cup cucumber  Instructions : o Cook shrimp and slice in half. o Cook rice vermicelli according to package instructions, then drain. o Soak rice paper wrappers in warm water until pliable. o Place a small amount of shrimp, vermicelli, lettuce, mint, cilantro, basil, julienned carrots, and cucumber on each wrapper. o Roll tightly and serve with dipping sauce. Gomae (Spinach with Sesame Dressing)

o 1 bunch spinach o 2 tablespoons sesame seeds o 1 tablespoon soy sauce o 1 tablespoon sugar o 1 tablespoon mirin  Instructions : o Blanch spinach in boiling water, then rinse in cold water and squeeze out excess moisture. o Toast sesame seeds and grind them. o Mix sesame seeds with soy sauce, sugar, and mirin. o Toss spinach with dressing and serve. Gratin Dauphinois

o 4 potatoes o 1 cup heavy cream o 1/2 cup milk o 2 cloves garlic o 1/2 cup grated Gruyère cheese o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper  Instructions : o Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). o Peel and thinly slice potatoes. o Rub a baking dish with a cut clove of garlic. o Layer potatoes in the dish, seasoning with salt and pepper. o Mix cream, milk, and minced garlic, pour over potatoes. o Sprinkle with grated Gruyère cheese. o Bake for 45 minutes until golden and bubbly. o Serve warm. Greek Salad

o 4 tomatoes o 1 cucumber o 1 small red onion o 1/4 cup olives o 1/4 cup feta cheese o 1/4 cup olive oil o 2 tablespoons red wine vinegar o 1 teaspoon oregano o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions : o Dice tomatoes and cucumber, slice red onion. o Mix vegetables with olives and crumbled feta cheese. o Whisk olive oil, vinegar, oregano, and salt, then pour over salad. o Toss well and serve. Green Bean Casserole

o 4 cups green beans o 1 can cream of mushroom soup o 1/2 cup milk o 1 cup fried onions o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper  Instructions : o Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). o Cook green beans until tender. o Mix soup, milk, salt, and pepper in a baking dish. o Add green beans and half of the fried onions, stir to combine. o Bake for 25 minutes. o Top with remaining fried onions and bake for an additional 5 minutes. o Serve warm. Guacamole

o 3 avocados o 1 lime o 1 small onion o 2 tomatoes o 1 teaspoon salt o 1 tablespoon chopped cilantro o 1 teaspoon minced garlic  Instructions : o Cut avocados in half, remove the pit, and scoop out the flesh into a bowl. o Mash the avocados with a fork. o Add lime juice, diced onion, chopped tomatoes, salt, cilantro, and garlic. o Mix well and serve immediately. Gurkensalat (Cucumber Salad)

o 4 eggs o 1 cup water o 1/4 cup green onions o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon sesame oil  Instructions : o Beat eggs with water, salt, and chopped green onions. o Pour mixture into a heatproof bowl. o Steam for 10-15 minutes until set. o Drizzle with sesame oil and serve warm. Harira
o 1 cup lentils o 1/2 cup chickpeas o 1 small onion

o 2 cloves garlic o 4 tomatoes o 4 cups vegetable broth o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 teaspoon coriander o 1 teaspoon turmeric o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/4 cup cilantro  Instructions : o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic until softened. o Add diced tomatoes, lentils, chickpeas, vegetable broth, cumin, coriander, turmeric, and salt. o Simmer for 30 minutes until lentils are tender. o Stir in chopped cilantro and serve warm. Horta

o 1 pound dandelion greens o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1/4 cup lemon juice o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions : o Boil dandelion greens until tender, then drain. o Toss greens with olive oil, lemon juice, and salt. o Serve warm or chilled. Hot and Sour Soup

o 4 cups chicken broth o 1/2 cup sliced mushrooms o 1/4 cup bamboo shoots o 1/4 cup tofu o 2 tablespoons soy sauce o 2 tablespoons rice vinegar o 1 tablespoon cornstarch o 1 teaspoon chili paste o 1 egg o 1/4 cup chopped green onions  Instructions : o Bring chicken broth to a boil. o Add mushrooms, bamboo shoots, tofu, soy sauce, rice vinegar, and chili paste. o Mix cornstarch with water and add to the soup, stirring until thickened. o Beat egg and slowly pour into the soup, stirring constantly. o Garnish with chopped green onions and serve.

o 1 can chickpeas o 1/4 cup tahini o 1/4 cup lemon juice o 2 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions : o Drain and rinse chickpeas. o Blend chickpeas, tahini, lemon juice, minced garlic, and salt in a food processor. o Slowly add olive oil while blending until smooth. o Serve with a drizzle of olive oil. Japchae

o 8 ounces sweet potato noodles o 1/2 pound beef o 1 small onion o 1 carrot o 1 bell pepper o 1 cup spinach o 2 tablespoons soy sauce o 1 tablespoon sesame oil o 1 tablespoon sugar o 1 tablespoon sesame seeds  Instructions : o Cook noodles according to package instructions, then drain. o Sauté sliced beef, diced onion, julienned carrot, and bell pepper in sesame oil until cooked. o Add spinach and cook until wilted. o Mix noodles with soy sauce, sugar, and sesame seeds. o Combine with cooked beef and vegetables. o Serve warm. Jerk Vegetables
o 1 cup broccoli o 1 cup bell peppers o 1 cup zucchini o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 2 tablespoons jerk seasoning
o Toss vegetables with minced garlic, jerk seasoning, and olive oil. o Roast at 400°F (200°C) until tender. o Serve warm. Johnny Cakes

o 2 cups flour o 1/4 cup sugar o 1 tablespoon baking powder o 1/2 teaspoon salt o 1/4 cup butter o 1/2 cup milk o Oil for frying  Instructions : o Mix flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a bowl. o Cut in cold butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. o Add milk and stir until dough forms. o Roll out dough and cut into circles. o Fry in hot oil until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve warm. Jollof Rice

o 2 cups rice o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 4 tomatoes o 1/4 cup tomato paste o 1/4 cup vegetable oil o 1 teaspoon thyme o 1 teaspoon curry powder o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper o 4 cups chicken broth  Instructions : o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic in vegetable oil until softened. o Add diced tomatoes, tomato paste, thyme, curry powder, salt, and pepper, cook for 5 minutes. o Stir in rice and cook for 2 minutes. o Add chicken broth and bring to a boil. o Reduce heat, cover, and simmer until rice is tender. o Serve warm.

o 4 tomatoes o 1 small onion o 1 cucumber o 1/4 cup cilantro o 1/4 cup lemon juice o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions : o Dice tomatoes, onion, and cucumber. o Mix vegetables with chopped cilantro, lemon juice, and salt. o Serve chilled. Käsespätzle (Cheese Noodles)

o 2 cups flour o 1/2 cup milk o 3 eggs o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/4 teaspoon nutmeg o 1/4 cup butter o 1 cup grated cheese o 1 small onion  Instructions : o Mix flour, milk, beaten eggs, salt, and nutmeg to form a batter. o Press batter through a spaetzle maker or colander into boiling water. o Cook until spaetzle floats to the surface, then drain. o Sauté sliced onion in butter until golden. o Layer spaetzle and grated cheese in a baking dish, top with sautéed onion. o Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 15 minutes until cheese is melted. o Serve warm. Kartoffelsalat (Potato Salad)
o 4 potatoes o 1 small onion o 1/4 cup bacon o 1/4 cup vinegar o 1/4 cup chicken broth o 1 tablespoon mustard o 1 teaspoon sugar o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper

o Boil potatoes until tender, then dice. o Cook diced bacon until crispy, then remove and set aside. o Sauté diced onion in bacon fat until softened. o Mix vinegar, chicken broth, mustard, sugar, salt, and pepper in a bowl. o Combine potatoes, bacon, and onion with the dressing. o Serve warm or chilled. Keftedes

o 1/2 pound ground beef o 1/2 pound ground pork o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup breadcrumbs o 1 egg o 1 teaspoon oregano o 1 teaspoon mint o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper o Oil for frying  Instructions : o Mix ground beef, ground pork, diced onion, minced garlic, breadcrumbs, beaten egg, oregano, mint, salt, and pepper in a bowl. o Form mixture into meatballs. o Heat oil in a pan and fry meatballs until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve warm. Kibbeh

o 1 cup bulgur o 1/2 pound ground beef o 1 small onion o 1/4 cup pine nuts o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 teaspoon allspice o 1 teaspoon salt o Oil for frying  Instructions : o Soak bulgur in water until tender, then drain. o Mix bulgur with ground beef, diced onion, pine nuts, cumin, allspice, and salt. o Form mixture into balls or patties. o Fry in hot oil until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve.

o 1 napa cabbage o 1/4 cup sea salt o 1 tablespoon sugar o 2 tablespoons fish sauce o 2 tablespoons gochugaru (Korean chili powder) o 4 cloves garlic o 1 inch ginger o 4 green onions  Instructions : o Cut cabbage into quarters and soak in salted water for 2 hours. o Rinse and drain cabbage. o Mix sugar, fish sauce, gochugaru, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green onions in a bowl. o Rub mixture onto cabbage leaves. o Pack cabbage into a jar and let ferment at room temperature for 2-3 days. o Store in the refrigerator and serve as needed. Kongnamul Muchim

o 1 pound soybean sprouts o 2 cloves garlic o 2 tablespoons soy sauce o 1 tablespoon sesame oil o 1 tablespoon sesame seeds  Instructions : o Blanch soybean sprouts in boiling water for 2 minutes, then drain. o Mix minced garlic, soy sauce, sesame oil, and sesame seeds in a bowl. o Toss sprouts with the dressing. o Serve chilled. Labneh

o 2 cups yogurt o 1/2 teaspoon salt o 1/4 cup olive oil  Instructions : o Mix yogurt with salt. o Place yogurt in a cheesecloth-lined strainer over a bowl. o Let drain in the refrigerator for 24 hours. o Transfer labneh to a serving dish and drizzle with olive oil. o Serve with pita bread.

o 1/2 pound ground chicken o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 2 tablespoons fish sauce o 2 tablespoons lime juice o 1 tablespoon sugar o 1 tablespoon rice powder o 1/4 cup mint o 1/4 cup cilantro o 1-2 Thai chilies  Instructions : o Sauté ground chicken, diced onion, and minced garlic until cooked. o Mix fish sauce, lime juice, sugar, and rice powder in a bowl. o Toss chicken with the dressing, chopped mint, cilantro, and sliced chilies. o Serve with lettuce leaves. Lo Mein

o 8 ounces lo mein noodles o 1 cup sliced bell peppers o 1 cup snow peas o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 2 tablespoons soy sauce o 1 tablespoon oyster sauce o 1 tablespoon sesame oil  Instructions : o Cook lo mein noodles according to package instructions, then drain. o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic in sesame oil until fragrant. o Add bell peppers and snow peas, stir-fry until tender. o Add cooked noodles, soy sauce, and oyster sauce, stir to combine. o Serve warm. Loubia

o 2 cups white beans o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 4 tomatoes o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 teaspoon paprika o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/4 cup cilantro  Instructions : o Soak beans overnight, then cook until tender. o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic in olive oil until softened. o Add diced tomatoes, cumin, paprika, and salt, simmer for 10 minutes. o Mix beans with tomato sauce and cook for 10 minutes. o Stir in chopped cilantro and serve warm. Macaroni and Cheese

o 2 cups elbow macaroni o 2 cups milk o 2 tablespoons butter o 2 tablespoons flour o 2 cups shredded cheddar cheese o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper  Instructions : o Cook macaroni according to package instructions, then drain. o Melt butter in a saucepan, stir in flour to make a roux. o Gradually add milk, stirring constantly until thickened. o Add cheese, salt, and pepper, stir until melted. o Combine cheese sauce with macaroni. o Serve warm. Manakish

o 2 cups flour o 1/4 cup sugar o 1 tablespoon baking powder o 1/2 teaspoon salt o 1/4 cup coconut milk o 1/4 cup water o Oil for frying  Instructions : o Mix flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a bowl. o Add coconut milk and water, stir until dough forms. o Roll out dough and cut into triangles. o Fry in hot oil until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve warm. Mandu

o 1 package dumpling wrappers o 1/2 pound ground pork o 1/2 cup chopped cabbage o 1/4 cup chopped green onions o 2 cloves garlic o 1 tablespoon soy sauce o 1 teaspoon sesame oil o Oil for frying  Instructions : o Mix ground pork, cabbage, green onions, minced garlic, soy sauce, and sesame o Place a spoonful of filling on each wrapper and fold to seal. o Fry in hot oil until golden, then steam for 5 minutes. o Serve with dipping sauce. Mango Sticky Rice

o 1 cup glutinous rice o 1 cup coconut milk o 1/4 cup sugar o 1/4 teaspoon salt o 2 mangoes  Instructions : o Rinse rice and soak in water for 1 hour. o Steam rice until tender. o Heat coconut milk with sugar and salt until dissolved. o Mix coconut milk with cooked rice and let sit for 10 minutes. o Serve rice with sliced mangoes. Mapo Tofu

o 1 block tofu o 1/2 pound ground pork o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1 tablespoon chili bean paste o 2 tablespoons soy sauce o 1 tablespoon rice wine o 1 teaspoon sugar o 1/4 cup chicken broth o 1 tablespoon cornstarch o 1/4 cup chopped green onions  Instructions : o Cut tofu into cubes and set aside. o Sauté ground pork, diced onion, and minced garlic until browned. o Add chili bean paste, soy sauce, rice wine, and sugar, cook for 2 minutes. o Add chicken broth and tofu, simmer for 5 minutes. o Mix cornstarch with water and add to the pan, stirring until thickened. o Garnish with chopped green onions and serve. Mashed Potatoes

o 4 potatoes o 1/2 cup milk o 1/4 cup butter o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper  Instructions : o Peel and dice potatoes. o Boil potatoes until tender, then drain. o Mash potatoes with milk, butter, salt, and pepper. o Serve warm. Minestrone

o 1 onion o 2 carrots o 2 celery stalks o 2 cloves garlic o 1 zucchini o 1 can diced tomatoes o 4 cups vegetable broth o 1 can cannellini beans o 1 cup pasta o 1/4 cup basil o 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese  Instructions : o Sauté diced onion, carrots, celery, and minced garlic until softened. o Add diced zucchini, tomatoes, and broth. o Bring to a boil, then simmer for 20 minutes. o Add beans and pasta, cook until pasta is tender. o Stir in chopped basil and serve with grated Parmesan cheese. Miso Soup

o 4 cups dashi broth o 1/4 cup miso paste o 1/2 cup tofu o 1/4 cup green onions o 1/4 cup seaweed  Instructions : o Heat dashi broth until warm. o Dissolve miso paste in a small amount of broth, then add to the pot. o Add diced tofu and seaweed. o Simmer for 5 minutes. o Garnish with sliced green onions and serve. Moqueca de Banana

o 4 bananas o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1 bell pepper o 2 tomatoes o 1 cup coconut milk o 1/4 cup cilantro o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper  Instructions : o Sauté diced onion, minced garlic, and sliced bell pepper until softened. o Add diced tomatoes and cook for 5 minutes. o Stir in coconut milk, sliced bananas, salt, and pepper. o Simmer for 10 minutes. o Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve warm.

o 2 cups flour o 1 cup semolina o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1 cup water o 1/4 cup butter  Instructions : o Mix flour, semolina, and salt in a bowl. o Add water and knead until smooth. o Divide dough into balls and roll out into thin circles. o Brush with melted butter and fold into squares. o Cook on a hot griddle until golden on both sides. o Serve warm. Muhammara

o 2 red bell peppers o 1/2 cup walnuts o 1/4 cup breadcrumbs o 2 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1 tablespoon pomegranate molasses o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions : o Roast bell peppers until charred, then peel and seed. o Blend peppers, walnuts, breadcrumbs, minced garlic, olive oil, pomegranate molasses, cumin, and salt in a food processor until smooth. o Serve with pita bread. Mutabal

o 2 1/4 teaspoons active dry yeast o 1 teaspoon sugar o 1/2 cup warm water o 2 1/2 cups flour o 1/2 cup yogurt o 1/4 cup melted butter o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions : o Dissolve yeast and sugar in warm water, let sit until foamy. o Mix flour and salt in a bowl, then add yeast mixture, yogurt, and melted butter. o Knead until smooth, then let rise until doubled. o Divide dough into balls and roll out into circles. o Cook on a hot griddle until bubbles form, then flip and cook the other side. o Brush with melted butter and serve warm. Nom Du Du (Green Papaya Salad)

o 1 green papaya o 2 carrots o 1/4 cup peanuts o 1/4 cup cilantro o 2 tablespoons fish sauce o 2 tablespoons lime juice o 1 tablespoon sugar o 1-2 Thai chilies  Instructions : o Peel and shred green papaya and carrots. o Crush peanuts and chop cilantro. o Mix fish sauce, lime juice, sugar, and sliced chilies in a bowl. o Toss shredded papaya, carrots, peanuts, and cilantro with the dressing. o Serve chilled. Nuoc Cham

o 1/4 cup fish sauce o 1/4 cup lime juice o 2 tablespoons sugar o 2 cloves garlic o 1-2 Thai chilies o 1/4 cup water  Instructions : o Mix fish sauce, lime juice, sugar, minced garlic, and sliced chilies in a bowl. o Add water and stir until sugar is dissolved. o Serve as a dipping sauce. Oi Muchim

o 2 cucumbers o 2 cloves garlic o 2 tablespoons soy sauce o 1 tablespoon sesame oil o 1 tablespoon gochugaru (Korean chili powder) o 1 tablespoon sesame seeds  Instructions : o Slice cucumbers thinly. o Mix minced garlic, soy sauce, sesame oil, gochugaru, and sesame seeds in a bowl. o Toss cucumbers with the dressing. o Serve chilled. Onigiri (Rice Balls)

o 2 cups cooked sushi rice o 1/4 cup filling (salmon, pickled plum) o 1 sheet nori (seaweed)  Instructions : o Wet hands and shape rice into balls or triangles. o Make a small indentation and add filling. o Wrap with a strip of nori. o Serve immediately. Pão de Queijo

o 2 cups tapioca flour o 1 cup milk o 1/2 cup butter o 1 teaspoon salt o 1 cup grated Parmesan cheese o 2 eggs  Instructions : o Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). o Heat milk, butter, and salt in a saucepan until boiling. o Remove from heat and stir in tapioca flour until smooth. o Let cool slightly, then mix in grated cheese and beaten eggs. o Form dough into balls and place on a baking sheet. o Bake for 20-25 minutes until golden. o Serve warm. Pad See Ew

o 8 ounces wide rice noodles o 1/2 pound chicken breast o 1 cup broccoli o 2 eggs o 2 tablespoons soy sauce o 2 tablespoons oyster sauce o 1 tablespoon sugar o 1 tablespoon vegetable oil  Instructions : o Soak rice noodles in warm water until softened, then drain. o Sauté sliced chicken in vegetable oil until cooked, then set aside. o Scramble eggs in the same pan. o Add noodles, soy sauce, oyster sauce, and sugar, stir to combine. o Add broccoli and cooked chicken, stir-fry until heated through. o Serve warm. Pad Thai

o 8 ounces rice noodles o 1/2 pound shrimp o 2 eggs o 1 cup bean sprouts o 1/4 cup peanuts o 2 tablespoons fish sauce o 2 tablespoons tamarind paste o 1 tablespoon sugar o 1 tablespoon lime juice o 1/4 cup green onions  Instructions : o Soak rice noodles in warm water until softened, then drain. o Sauté shrimp in a pan until cooked, then set aside.

o Scramble eggs in the same pan. o Add noodles, fish sauce, tamarind paste, sugar, and lime juice, stir to combine. o Add bean sprouts, cooked shrimp, and chopped green onions. o Garnish with crushed peanuts and serve. Pajeon (Pancakes)

o 1 cup flour o 1 cup water o 1 egg o 1/2 cup green onions o 1/2 cup seafood (optional) o 1 tablespoon soy sauce o 1 tablespoon sesame oil  Instructions : o Mix flour, water, and beaten egg in a bowl. o Add chopped green onions and seafood (if using). o Heat sesame oil in a pan and pour in batter. o Cook until golden on both sides. o Serve with soy sauce for dipping. Pan con Tomate

o 1 baguette o 4 tomatoes o 2 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions : o Slice baguette and toast until golden. o Rub toasted bread with cut garlic cloves. o Grate tomatoes and spread on bread. o Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt. o Serve immediately. Paneer Tikka
o 1 pound paneer o 1/2 cup yogurt o 1 tablespoon lemon juice o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 teaspoon coriander o 1 teaspoon garam masala o 1 teaspoon turmeric

subsection_analysis.section_title: o  1 teaspoon salt o  Skewers   Instructions :
subsection_analysis.refined_text: o Cut paneer into cubes. o Mix yogurt, lemon juice, cumin, coriander, garam masala, turmeric, and salt in a bowl. o Add paneer cubes and marinate for at least 1 hour. o Thread paneer onto skewers. o Grill or broil until golden, turning occasionally. o Serve warm. Panzanella

o 4 cups cubed bread o 4 tomatoes o 1 cucumber o 1 small red onion o 1/4 cup basil o 1/4 cup olive oil o 2 tablespoons red wine vinegar o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions : o Toast bread cubes until golden. o Dice tomatoes and cucumber, slice red onion. o Mix bread, tomatoes, cucumber, onion, and chopped basil. o Whisk olive oil, vinegar, and salt, then pour over salad. o Toss well and serve. Papadum

o 1 cup urad dal flour o 1/4 cup water o 1/2 teaspoon salt o Oil for frying  Instructions : o Mix urad dal flour, water, and salt to form a dough. o Roll dough into thin circles. o Fry in hot oil until crispy. o Drain on paper towels and serve. Patatas Bravas

o 4 potatoes o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1/2 cup tomato sauce o 1 teaspoon paprika o 1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper o 1/2 teaspoon salt o 1/4 cup mayonnaise  Instructions : o Peel and dice potatoes. o Toss potatoes with olive oil and salt, then roast at 400°F (200°C) until crispy. o Mix tomato sauce, paprika, and cayenne pepper in a bowl. o Serve potatoes with tomato sauce and a dollop of mayonnaise. Pepper Pot

o 1 pound beef o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 4 cups beef broth o 1 cup spinach o 1 cup okra o 1 teaspoon thyme o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper  Instructions : o Sauté diced beef, onion, and minced garlic until browned. o Add beef broth, thyme, salt, and pepper, simmer for 1 hour. o Stir in spinach and okra, cook until tender. o Serve warm. Peri-Peri Chicken

o 1 pound chicken thighs o 1/4 cup peri-peri sauce o 2 tablespoons olive oil o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper  Instructions : o Marinate chicken in peri-peri sauce, olive oil, salt, and pepper for at least 1 hour. o Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). o Arrange chicken on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes until cooked

o 4 tomatoes o 1 small onion o 1 jalapeño o 1/4 cup cilantro o 1 lime o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions : o Dice tomatoes, onion, and jalapeño. o Chop cilantro. o Combine all ingredients in a bowl. o Squeeze lime juice over the mixture and add salt. o Mix well and serve. Pimientos de Padrón

o 1 pound Padrón peppers o 2 tablespoons olive oil o 1 teaspoon sea salt  Instructions : o Heat olive oil in a pan. o Add Padrón peppers and sauté until blistered and tender. o Sprinkle with sea salt and serve warm. Plantain Chips

o 2 green plantains o 1 cup vegetable oil o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions : o Peel and slice plantains thinly. o Heat oil in a pan and fry plantain slices until crispy. o Drain on paper towels and sprinkle with salt. o Serve warm. Polenta

o 1 cup cornmeal o 4 cups water o 1 teaspoon salt o 2 tablespoons butter o 1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese  Instructions : o Bring water and salt to a boil. o Gradually whisk in cornmeal. o Reduce heat and cook, stirring constantly, until thickened (about 30 minutes).

o 4 potatoes o 2 eggs o 1 small onion o 1/2 cup mayonnaise o 2 tablespoons mustard o 1 tablespoon vinegar o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper  Instructions : o Boil potatoes until tender, then dice. o Hard-boil eggs, then chop. o Mix potatoes, eggs, diced onion, mayonnaise, mustard, vinegar, salt, and pepper. o Chill for at least 1 hour before serving. Pretzels

o 2 1/4 teaspoons active dry yeast o 1 teaspoon sugar o 1 cup warm water o 3 cups flour o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/4 cup baking soda o 1 egg o Coarse salt  Instructions : o Dissolve yeast and sugar in warm water, let sit until foamy. o Mix flour and salt in a bowl, then add yeast mixture. o Knead until smooth, then let rise until doubled. o Divide dough into pieces and roll into ropes, then shape into pretzels. o Boil water with baking soda and dip pretzels in the solution. o Place on a baking sheet, brush with beaten egg, and sprinkle with coarse salt. o Bake at 450°F (230°C) for 12-15 minutes until golden. o Serve warm. Pulao

o 1 cup basmati rice o 2 cups water o 1 small onion o 1 carrot o 1/2 cup peas o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 teaspoon coriander o 1 teaspoon turmeric o 1 teaspoon garam masala o 1 teaspoon salt o 2 tablespoons oil  Instructions : o Rinse rice and soak in water for 30 minutes. o Heat oil in a pan and sauté diced onion until translucent. o Add diced carrot, peas, cumin, coriander, turmeric, and garam masala, cook for 1 minute. o Drain rice and add to the pan, stir to coat with spices. o Add water and bring to a boil. o Reduce heat, cover, and simmer until rice is tender and water is absorbed. o Add salt to taste and serve. Quesadillas

o 4 flour tortillas o 2 cups shredded cheese o 1/2 cup diced cooked chicken (optional) o 1/4 cup chopped cilantro o 1 tablespoon vegetable oil  Instructions : o Heat oil in a pan. o Place a tortilla in the pan and sprinkle with cheese, chicken, and cilantro. o Top with another tortilla. o Cook until cheese is melted and tortilla is golden, then flip and cook the other

o 1 pie crust o 6 slices bacon o 1 small onion o 1 cup grated Gruyère cheese o 3 eggs o 1 cup heavy cream o 1/2 teaspoon salt o 1/4 teaspoon pepper  Instructions : o Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). o Cook bacon until crispy, then crumble. o Sauté diced onion in bacon fat until softened. o Place pie crust in a pie dish and sprinkle with bacon, onion, and cheese. o Beat eggs with cream, salt, and pepper, then pour over the filling. o Bake for 30-35 minutes until set and golden. o Serve warm. Quindim

o 2 cups sugar o 1 cup coconut o 1/4 cup butter o 10 egg yolks o 1 teaspoon vanilla extract  Instructions : o Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). o Mix sugar, coconut, melted butter, egg yolks, and vanilla extract in a bowl. o Pour mixture into greased muffin tins. o Bake for 30-35 minutes until set and golden. o Let cool before removing from tins. o Serve chilled. Raita

o 1 cup yogurt o 1/2 cucumber o 1/4 cup mint o 1/4 teaspoon cumin o 1/4 teaspoon salt  Instructions : o Grate cucumber and squeeze out excess moisture. o Mix yogurt with cucumber, chopped mint, cumin, and salt. o Serve chilled. Ratatouille

o 1 eggplant o 1 zucchini o 1 bell pepper o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 4 tomatoes o 1 teaspoon thyme o 1 teaspoon rosemary o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions : o Dice eggplant, zucchini, bell pepper, and tomatoes. o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic in olive oil until softened. o Add eggplant, zucchini, bell pepper, tomatoes, thyme, rosemary, and salt. o Simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. o Serve warm. Rau Muong Xao Toi (Stir-Fried Morning Glory with Garlic)

o 1 pound morning glory o 4 cloves garlic o 2 tablespoons fish sauce o 1 tablespoon vegetable oil  Instructions : o Sauté minced garlic in vegetable oil until fragrant. o Add morning glory and stir-fry until tender. o Add fish sauce and cook for 2 minutes. o Serve warm. Refried Beans

o 2 cups cooked pinto beans o 1/4 cup lard or vegetable oil o 1 small onion o 1 clove garlic o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions : o Heat lard or oil in a pan and sauté diced onion and minced garlic until translucent. o Add beans and mash with a potato masher. o Cook, stirring frequently, until beans are thickened. o Add salt to taste and serve. Rfissa

o 1 pound chicken o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 teaspoon turmeric o 1 teaspoon ginger o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/4 cup olive oil o 4 cups chicken broth o 1/4 cup lentils o 1/4 cup cilantro o 4 pieces flatbread  Instructions : o Sauté chicken, diced onion, and minced garlic in olive oil until browned. o Add cumin, turmeric, ginger, and salt, cook for 1 minute. o Add chicken broth and lentils, simmer until chicken is cooked and lentils are tender. o Stir in chopped cilantro. o Tear flatbread into pieces and place in a serving dish. o Pour chicken and sauce over the bread and serve warm. Rice and Peas

o 1 cup rice o 1 cup coconut milk o 1 cup water o 1/2 cup kidney beans o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1 teaspoon thyme o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions : o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic until softened. o Add rice, coconut milk, water, kidney beans, thyme, and salt. o Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until rice is tender. o Serve warm. Rillettes

o 1 pound pork shoulder o 1/2 cup duck fat o 1/4 cup white wine o 1 teaspoon thyme o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper  Instructions : o Cut pork into small pieces. o Cook pork with duck fat, wine, thyme, salt, and pepper in a pot over low heat until very tender (about 3 hours). o Shred pork with a fork and pack into jars.

o 1 cup Arborio rice o 4 cups chicken broth o 1/2 cup white wine o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese o 2 tablespoons butter o 1 tablespoon olive oil  Instructions : o Heat broth in a pot and keep warm. o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic in olive oil until translucent. o Add rice and cook until lightly toasted. o Pour in wine and cook until absorbed. o Add broth one ladle at a time, stirring constantly until absorbed. o Continue until rice is creamy and tender. o Stir in butter and grated Parmesan cheese. o Serve immediately. Rösti (Potato Pancakes)

o 4 potatoes o 1 small onion o 1/4 cup flour o 1 egg o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper o Oil for frying  Instructions : o Grate potatoes and onion, then squeeze out excess moisture. o Mix with flour, beaten egg, salt, and pepper. o Form mixture into patties. o Fry in hot oil until golden on both sides. o Drain on paper towels and serve warm. Rotkohl (Braised Red Cabbage)

o 1/2 pound kefalotyri cheese o 1/4 cup flour o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1 lemon  Instructions : o Cut cheese into slices. o Dredge cheese in flour. o Heat olive oil in a pan and fry cheese until golden on both sides. o Squeeze lemon juice over the top and serve immediately. Salade Niçoise

o 4 tomatoes o 1 cucumber o 1 small red onion o 1/4 cup olives o 1/4 cup green beans o 2 hard-boiled eggs o 1 can tuna o 1/4 cup olive oil o 2 tablespoons red wine vinegar o 1 teaspoon Dijon mustard o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions : o Dice tomatoes and cucumber, slice red onion. o Blanch green beans until tender. o Arrange tomatoes, cucumber, onion, green beans, olives, and tuna on a plate. o Quarter hard-boiled eggs and add to the salad. o Whisk olive oil, vinegar, mustard, and salt, then drizzle over the salad. o Toss gently and serve.

o 2 cups shredded chicken o 1 small onion o 1 carrot o 1 apple o 1/4 cup raisins o 1/4 cup mayonnaise o 1/4 cup parsley o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions : o Dice onion, grate carrot, and chop apple. o Mix shredded chicken with onion, carrot, apple, raisins, mayonnaise, chopped

o 1 pound salted cod o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1/2 cup flour o 1/4 cup water o 1 teaspoon thyme o 1 teaspoon salt o Oil for frying  Instructions : o Soak salted cod in water overnight, then rinse and flake. o Mix cod with diced onion, minced garlic, flour, water, thyme, and salt. o Form mixture into fritters. o Fry in hot oil until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve warm. Samosa

o 2 cups flour o 1/4 cup oil o 1/2 cup water o 2 potatoes o 1/2 cup peas o 1 small onion o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 teaspoon coriander o 1 teaspoon garam masala o 1 teaspoon salt o Oil for frying  Instructions : o Mix flour, oil, and water to form a dough, then let rest. o Boil and mash potatoes, then mix with peas, diced onion, and spices. o Roll dough into circles, cut in half, and form cones. o Fill cones with potato mixture and seal edges. o Fry in hot oil until golden. o Serve warm. Satay

o 1 pound chicken breast o 1/4 cup coconut milk o 2 tablespoons soy sauce o 2 tablespoons peanut butter o 1 tablespoon curry powder o 1 tablespoon brown sugar o Skewers  Instructions : o Cut chicken into strips and thread onto skewers. o Mix coconut milk, soy sauce, peanut butter, curry powder, and brown sugar in a bowl. o Marinate chicken in the mixture for at least 1 hour. o Grill or broil until cooked through. o Serve with peanut sauce. Sauerkraut

o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1 bell pepper o 4 tomatoes o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 teaspoon paprika o 1 teaspoon salt o 4 eggs o 1/4 cup parsley  Instructions : o Sauté diced onion, minced garlic, and diced bell pepper until softened. o Add diced tomatoes, cumin, paprika, and salt, simmer for 10 minutes. o Make wells in the sauce and crack eggs into each well. o Cover and cook until eggs are set. o Garnish with chopped parsley and serve. Shawarma

o 1 pound chicken thighs o 1/4 cup yogurt o 2 tablespoons lemon juice o 2 cloves garlic o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 teaspoon paprika o 1 teaspoon turmeric o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper  Instructions : o Mix yogurt, lemon juice, minced garlic, cumin, paprika, turmeric, salt, and pepper in a bowl. o Marinate chicken in the mixture for at least 2 hours. o Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). o Arrange chicken on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes until cooked
o Serve as a dip or side dish. Som Tum (Green Papaya Salad)

o 1 green papaya o 2 tomatoes o 1 carrot o 2 cloves garlic o 2 tablespoons fish sauce o 2 tablespoons lime juice o 1 tablespoon sugar o 1 tablespoon peanuts o 1-2 Thai chilies  Instructions : o Peel and shred green papaya and carrot. o Crush garlic and chilies in a mortar and pestle. o Add fish sauce, lime juice, and sugar, mix well. o Toss shredded papaya, carrot, and sliced tomatoes with the dressing. o Garnish with crushed peanuts and serve. Sopa de Tortilla

o 4 corn tortillas o 1 tablespoon vegetable oil o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 4 cups chicken broth o 2 tomatoes o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 avocado o 1/4 cup cilantro  Instructions : o Cut tortillas into strips and fry in oil until crispy. o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic in a pot until translucent. o Add diced tomatoes and cumin, cook for 5 minutes. o Pour in chicken broth and bring to a boil. o Simmer for 10 minutes. o Serve soup topped with tortilla strips, diced avocado, and chopped cilantro.

• 1 whole wheat tortilla • 1 cup cooked chicken breast, sliced • 1 cup romaine lettuce, chopped • 2 tablespoons Caesar dressing • 2 tablespoons grated Parmesan cheese • Optional: croutons for extra crunch Instructions: • Lay the tortilla flat and spread the Caesar dressing evenly. • Add the chicken, lettuce, and Parmesan cheese. • Roll up the tortilla tightly and slice in half.

• 1 cup cooked quinoa • 1/2 cup cherry tomatoes, halved • 1/2 cucumber, diced • 1/4 cup red onion, finely chopped • 1/4 cup feta cheese, crumbled • 2 tablespoons olive oil • 1 tablespoon lemon juice • Salt and pepper to taste Instructions: • In a large bowl, combine the quinoa, tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, and feta cheese. • Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice. • Season with salt and pepper, then toss to combine.

• 2 slices whole grain bread • 4 slices turkey breast • 1/2 avocado, sliced • 1/2 cup spinach leaves • 1 tablespoon mustard or mayo Instructions: • Spread mustard or mayo on one slice of bread. • Layer the turkey, avocado, and spinach on top. • Top with the second slice of bread and cut in half.

• 1 cup Greek yogurt • 1/2 cup granola • 1/2 cup mixed berries (strawberries, blueberries, raspberries) • 1 tablespoon honey Instructions: • In a bowl or jar, layer the Greek yogurt, granola, and mixed berries. • Drizzle with honey. • Repeat the layers if desired.

• 1 whole wheat pita bread • 1/2 cup hummus • 1/2 cup cucumber, sliced • 1/2 cup bell pepper, sliced • 1/4 cup shredded carrots • 1/4 cup baby spinach Instructions: • Cut the pita bread in half to create pockets. • Spread hummus inside each pocket. • Fill with cucumber, bell pepper, carrots, and spinach.

• 1 can tuna, drained • 1/4 cup mayonnaise • 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard • 1 celery stalk, diced • 1/4 cup red onion, finely chopped • Salt and pepper to taste • Lettuce leaves or whole grain bread for serving Instructions: • In a bowl, combine the tuna, mayonnaise, Dijon mustard, celery, and red onion. • Season with salt and pepper.

• 2 slices ciabatta bread • 1/2 cup fresh mozzarella, sliced • 1 tomato, sliced • Fresh basil leaves • 1 tablespoon balsamic glaze • 1 tablespoon olive oil • Salt and pepper to taste Instructions: • Drizzle olive oil on one slice of bread. • Layer the mozzarella, tomato, and basil on top. • Drizzle with balsamic glaze and season with salt and pepper. • Top with the second slice of bread and cut in half.

• 1 cup cooked chicken breast, shredded • 1/4 cup mayonnaise • 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard • 1 celery stalk, diced • 1/4 cup red grapes, halved • Salt and pepper to taste • Lettuce leaves for serving Instructions: • In a bowl, combine the chicken, mayonnaise, Dijon mustard, celery, and grapes. • Season with salt and pepper. • Serve in lettuce leaves.
• 1 whole wheat tortilla • 1/2 cup hummus • 1/2 cup cucumber, sliced • 1/2 cup bell pepper, sliced

subsection_analysis.section_title: •  1/4 cup shredded carrots •  1/4 cup baby spinach Instructions:
subsection_analysis.refined_text: • Lay the tortilla flat and spread the hummus evenly. • Add the cucumber, bell pepper, carrots, and spinach. • Roll up the tortilla tightly and slice in half.

• 4 hard-boiled eggs, chopped • 1/4 cup mayonnaise • 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard • 1 celery stalk, diced • Salt and pepper to taste • 2 slices whole grain bread Instructions: • In a bowl, combine the eggs, mayonnaise, Dijon mustard, and celery. • Season with salt and pepper. • Spread on one slice of bread and top with the second slice.

• 2 cups cooked pasta (such as rotini or penne) • 1/2 cup cherry tomatoes, halved • 1/2 cup cucumber, diced • 1/4 cup black olives, sliced • 1/4 cup feta cheese, crumbled • 2 tablespoons olive oil • 1 tablespoon red wine vinegar • Salt and pepper to taste Instructions: • In a large bowl, combine the pasta, tomatoes, cucumber, olives, and feta cheese. • Drizzle with olive oil and red wine vinegar. • Season with salt and pepper, then toss to combine.

• 1 cup cooked chicken breast, diced • 1/2 avocado, diced • 1/4 cup cherry tomatoes, halved • 1/4 cup red onion, finely chopped • 2 tablespoons olive oil • 1 tablespoon lemon juice • Salt and pepper to taste Instructions: • In a bowl, combine the chicken, avocado, tomatoes, and red onion. • Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice. • Season with salt and pepper, then toss to combine.

• 4 slices turkey breast • 4 slices cheese (such as cheddar or Swiss) • 1/2 cup baby spinach • 1/4 cup hummus Instructions: • Lay a slice of turkey flat and spread with hummus. • Place a slice of cheese and a few spinach leaves on top. • Roll up tightly and repeat with remaining ingredients.

• 1 can chickpeas, drained and rinsed • 1/2 cup cherry tomatoes, halved • 1/2 cucumber, diced • 1/4 cup red onion, finely chopped • 1/4 cup feta cheese, crumbled • 2 tablespoons olive oil • 1 tablespoon lemon juice • Salt and pepper to taste Instructions: • In a large bowl, combine the chickpeas, tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, and feta cheese. • Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice. • Season with salt and pepper, then toss to combine.

• 1 cup cooked chicken breast, sliced • 1/2 cup bell pepper, sliced • 1/2 cup broccoli florets • 1/4 cup snap peas • 2 tablespoons soy sauce • 1 tablespoon olive oil • 1 teaspoon sesame oil • Cooked rice for serving Instructions: • In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. • Add bell pepper, broccoli, and snap peas, and stir-fry until tender. • Add the cooked chicken and soy sauce, and stir to combine. • Drizzle with sesame oil and serve over rice.

• 1 cup cooked shrimp, peeled and deveined • 1/2 avocado, diced • 1/4 cup cherry tomatoes, halved • 1/4 cup red onion, finely chopped • 2 tablespoons olive oil • 1 tablespoon lemon juice • Salt and pepper to taste Instructions: • In a bowl, combine the shrimp, avocado, tomatoes, and red onion. • Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice. • Season with salt and pepper, then toss to combine.

subsection_analysis.section_title: Black Bean and Corn Salad Ingredients:
subsection_analysis.refined_text: • 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed • 1 cup corn kernels (fresh or canned) • 1/2 cup cherry tomatoes, halved • 1/4 cup red onion, finely chopped • 1/4 cup cilantro, chopped • 2 tablespoons olive oil • 1 tablespoon lime juice • Salt and pepper to taste Instructions: • In a large bowl, combine the black beans, corn, tomatoes, red onion, and cilantro. • Drizzle with olive oil and lime juice. • Season with salt and pepper, then toss to combine.

• 2 slices whole grain bread • 1 cup cooked chicken breast, sliced • 2 tablespoons pesto • 1/2 cup baby spinach • 1/4 cup roasted red peppers, sliced Instructions: • Spread pesto on one slice of bread. • Layer the chicken, spinach, and roasted red peppers on top. • Top with the second slice of bread and cut in half.

• 1 cup cooked lentils • 1/2 cup cherry tomatoes, halved • 1/2 cucumber, diced • 1/4 cup red onion, finely chopped • 1/4 cup feta cheese, crumbled • 2 tablespoons olive oil • 1 tablespoon red wine vinegar • Salt and pepper to taste Instructions: • In a large bowl, combine the lentils, tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, and feta cheese. • Drizzle with olive oil and red wine vinegar. • Season with salt and pepper, then toss to combine.

• 2 slices whole grain bread • 1/2 avocado, mashed • 1/2 cup chickpeas, mashed • 1/4 cup cherry tomatoes, halved • 1 tablespoon olive oil • Salt and pepper to taste Instructions: • In a bowl, combine the mashed avocado and chickpeas. • Spread the mixture on one slice of bread. • Top with cherry tomatoes and drizzle with olive oil. • Season with salt and pepper, then top with the second slice of bread.

• 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved • 1/2 cucumber, diced • 1/4 cup red onion, finely chopped • 1/4 cup black olives, sliced • 1/4 cup feta cheese, crumbled • 2 tablespoons olive oil • 1 tablespoon red wine vinegar • Salt and pepper to taste Instructions: • In a large bowl, combine the tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, olives, and feta cheese. • Drizzle with olive oil and red wine vinegar. • Season with salt and pepper, then toss to combine.

• 1 whole wheat tortilla • 4 slices turkey breast • 2 tablespoons cranberry sauce • 1/2 cup baby spinach • 1/4 cup shredded carrots Instructions: • Lay the tortilla flat and spread the cranberry sauce evenly. • Add the turkey, spinach, and carrots. • Roll up the tortilla tightly and slice in half.

• 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved • 1/2 cup fresh mozzarella, diced • Fresh basil leaves • 2 tablespoons olive oil • 1 tablespoon balsamic glaze • Salt and pepper to taste Instructions: • In a bowl, combine the tomatoes, mozzarella, and basil. • Drizzle with olive oil and balsamic glaze. • Season with salt and pepper, then toss to combine.

• 1 cup cooked chicken breast, cubed • 1/2 cup bell pepper, cubed • 1/2 cup zucchini, sliced • 1/4 cup red onion, cubed • 2 tablespoons olive oil • 1 tablespoon lemon juice • Salt and pepper to taste Instructions: • Thread the chicken, bell pepper, zucchini, and red onion onto skewers. • Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice. • Season with salt and pepper. • Serve cold or reheat before serving.

• 1 can tuna, drained • 1/2 avocado, diced • 1/4 cup cherry tomatoes, halved • 1/4 cup red onion, finely chopped • 2 tablespoons olive oil • 1 tablespoon lemon juice • Salt and pepper to taste Instructions: • In a bowl, combine the tuna, avocado, tomatoes, and red onion. • Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice. • Season with salt and pepper, then toss to combine.

• 1 cup cooked sushi rice • 1/2 cucumber, julienned • 1/2 avocado, sliced • 1/4 cup carrot, julienned • 2 sheets nori (seaweed) • Soy sauce for dipping Instructions: • Lay a sheet of nori on a bamboo sushi mat. • Spread a thin layer of sushi rice over the nori, leaving a 1-inch border at the top. • Arrange the cucumber, avocado, and carrot in a line along the bottom edge of the rice. • Roll the nori tightly using the bamboo mat. • Slice into bite-sized pieces and serve with soy sauce.

subsection_analysis.section_title: Spinach and Feta Stuﬀed Pita Ingredients:
subsection_analysis.refined_text: • 1 whole wheat pita bread • 1/2 cup spinach, chopped • 1/4 cup feta cheese, crumbled • 1/4 cup cherry tomatoes, halved • 1 tablespoon olive oil • Salt and pepper to taste Instructions: • Cut the pita bread in half to create pockets. • In a bowl, combine the spinach, feta cheese, and cherry tomatoes. • Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. • Stuﬀ the mixture into the pita pockets.

• 1 whole wheat tortilla • 1 cup cooked chicken breast, shredded • 2 tablespoons BBQ sauce • 1/4 cup shredded cheese • 1/4 cup coleslaw mix Instructions: • Lay the tortilla flat and spread the BBQ sauce evenly. • Add the chicken, cheese, and coleslaw mix. • Roll up the tortilla tightly and slice in half.

• 1 cup cooked couscous • 1/2 cup cherry tomatoes, halved • 1/2 cucumber, diced • 1/4 cup red onion, finely chopped • 1/4 cup feta cheese, crumbled • 2 tablespoons olive oil • 1 tablespoon lemon juice • Salt and pepper to taste Instructions: • In a large bowl, combine the couscous, tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, and feta cheese. • Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice. • Season with salt and pepper, then toss to combine.

• 2 slices whole grain bread • 1/2 cup roasted eggplant slices • 1/4 cup hummus • 1/4 cup baby spinach • 1/4 cup roasted red peppers, sliced Instructions: • Spread hummus on one slice of bread. • Layer the roasted eggplant, spinach, and roasted red peppers on top. • Top with the second slice of bread and cut in half.

• 1 cup cooked chicken breast, diced • 1/2 mango, diced • 1/4 cup red onion, finely chopped • 1/4 cup cilantro, chopped • 2 tablespoons olive oil • 1 tablespoon lime juice • Salt and pepper to taste Instructions: • In a bowl, combine the chicken, mango, red onion, and cilantro. • Drizzle with olive oil and lime juice. • Season with salt and pepper, then toss to combine.

• 1 whole wheat tortilla • 1/2 cup shredded cheese • 1/4 cup bell pepper, sliced • 1/4 cup zucchini, sliced • 1/4 cup red onion, sliced Instructions: • Lay the tortilla flat and sprinkle half of the cheese on one side. • Add the bell pepper, zucchini, and red onion. • Sprinkle the remaining cheese on top and fold the tortilla in half. • Cook in a skillet over medium heat until the cheese is melted and the tortilla is golden brown. • Slice into wedges.

• 1 whole wheat tortilla • 1/2 cup chickpeas, mashed • 1/4 cup spinach, chopped • 1/4 cup shredded carrots • 1 tablespoon tahini • 1 tablespoon lemon juice • Salt and pepper to taste Instructions: • In a bowl, combine the mashed chickpeas, spinach, carrots, tahini, and lemon juice. • Season with salt and pepper. • Lay the tortilla flat and spread the mixture evenly. • Roll up the tortilla tightly and slice in half.

• 2 slices whole grain bread • 4 slices turkey breast • 1/2 apple, thinly sliced • 1/4 cup baby spinach • 1 tablespoon mustard or mayo Instructions: • Spread mustard or mayo on one slice of bread. • Layer the turkey, apple slices, and spinach on top. • Top with the second slice of bread and cut in half.

• 1 can tuna, drained • 1/4 cup cherry tomatoes, halved • 1/4 cup cucumber, diced • 1/4 cup black olives, sliced • 1/4 cup feta cheese, crumbled • 2 tablespoons olive oil • 1 tablespoon lemon juice • Salt and pepper to taste Instructions: • In a bowl, combine the tuna, tomatoes, cucumber, olives, and feta cheese. • Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice. • Season with salt and pepper, then toss to combine.

• 1 whole wheat tortilla • 1 cup cooked chicken breast, sliced • 1/2 avocado, sliced • 1/4 cup baby spinach • 1 tablespoon ranch dressing Instructions: • Lay the tortilla flat and spread the ranch dressing evenly. • Add the chicken, avocado, and spinach. • Roll up the tortilla tightly and slice in half.

• 1 whole wheat tortilla • 1/2 cup cooked lentils • 1/4 cup bell pepper, sliced • 1/4 cup cucumber, diced • 1/4 cup shredded carrots • 1 tablespoon hummus Instructions: • Lay the tortilla flat and spread the hummus evenly. • Add the lentils, bell pepper, cucumber, and carrots. • Roll up the tortilla tightly and slice in half.

• 1 whole wheat tortilla • 4 slices turkey breast • 1/4 cup hummus • 1/4 cup shredded carrots • 1/4 cup baby spinach Instructions: • Lay the tortilla flat and spread the hummus evenly. • Add the turkey, carrots, and spinach. • Roll up the tortilla tightly and slice in half.
